intro: Macaranga eloba, commonly known as the giant mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Macaranga eloba is also known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
